channel.title: Item on item
channel.description:
Ok guys, So I've done this before but my server was lost in a recent crash of my computer. I was wondering if anyone would assist me with this because I forgot how to do this completely. Any and all help is appreciated
-Thanks
Zukyak

item.title: Item on item
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“Zukyak, post:6, topic:324816”][quote author=Pure Demons link=topic=421174.msg3093191#msg3093191 date=1263066585]

I cant just see what you need from your title. Explain a little more please. Be SPECIFIC.

I think he wants Item on Item.

Example:

if ((itemUsed == ####) && (useWith == ####)) {
sendMessage("THIS IS JUST A BASE");
}

Some Uses:

addItem(####, #);

= ItemID you want to add, # = Amount you want to add

sendMessage("message here");

message here = Message you want to send.

deleteItem(####, #);

= ItemID you want to delete, # = Amount you want to delete

Those are just some VERY basic functions.

[/quote]

To add skill requirments is like

 if(playerLevel)[15] >= 4

Is that right or did I miss something?[/quote]

if (playerLevel[##] >= ##) {

You were close.

Level IDs:

playerLevel[0] = Attack
playerLevel[1] = Defence
playerLevel[2] = Strength
playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints
playerLevel[4] = Range
playerLevel[5] = Prayer
playerLevel[6] = Magic
playerLevel[7] = Cooking
playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting
playerLevel[9] = Fletching
playerLevel[10] = Fishing
playerLevel[11] = Firemaking
playerLevel[12] = Crafting
playerLevel[13] = Smithing
playerLevel[14] = Mining
playerLevel[15] = Herblore
playerLevel[16] = Agility
playerLevel[17] = Thieving
playerLevel[18] = Slayer
playerLevel[19] = Farming
playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

Hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Item on item
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

Fatal Desire:

I cant just see what you need from your title. Explain a little more please. Be SPECIFIC.

I think they wants Item on Item.

Example:

if ((itemUsed == ####) && (useWith == ####)) {
sendMessage("THIS IS JUST A BASE");
}

Some Uses:

addItem(####, #);

= ItemID you want to add, # = Amount you want to add

sendMessage("message here");

message here = Message you want to send.

deleteItem(####, #);

= ItemID you want to delete, # = Amount you want to delete

Those are just some VERY basic functions.

Something you can use for:

if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == 1511)) { //Tinderbox with normal logs
	deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(1511), 1); //gets slot for logs
	makeGlobalObject(absX,absY, 2732, 0, 10); //makes fire at your position
	addSkillXP(1200, 11); //adds 1200 exp to firemaking
	sM("You attempt to light the logs."); //sends message
	sM("The fire catches and the logs begin to burn."); //sends message
}

^ That still needs the anims and everything for it, very simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Item on item
item.dc:creator: @Zukyak Zukyak
item.description:
@Zukyak wrote:

Fatal Desire:

I cant just see what you need from your title. Explain a little more please. Be SPECIFIC.

Item on item as in
Using an item on an item to receive another item…
(eg Herblore, Smithing,etc.)
